title: Why school should start later for teens
description: Teens don't get enough sleep, and it's not because of Snapchat, social lives or hormones -- it's because of public policy, says Wendy Troxel. Drawing from her experience as a sleep researcher, clinician and mother of a teenager, Troxel discusses how early school start times deprive adolescents of sleep during the time of their lives when they need it most.
author: Wendy Troxel
keywords: TED, talks, sleep, parenting, children, education, TEDx, community, health, personal growth, policy, science, social change, society
